items.label: cor-baoab-validity
items.title: BAOAB Discretization Validity
items.content:
1860: :label: cor-baoab-validity
1861: 
1862: **Hypotheses:** Consider the adaptive Langevin SDE with:
1863: 1. Fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho] \in C^3(\mathcal{X})$ with bounded derivatives (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity`)
1864: 2. Friction coefficient $\gamma > 0$
1865: 3. Temperature $T > 0$ (or equivalently, noise scale $\sigma > 0$)
1866: 4. Time step $\Delta t$ satisfying the stability criterion:
1867: $$
1868: \Delta t \le \Delta t_{\max}(\rho, \gamma) := \min\left( \frac{1}{2\gamma}, \frac{\rho^{3/2}}{K_{V,3}(\rho)^{1/2}} \right)
1869: $$
1870: 
1871: **Conclusion:** The BAOAB splitting integrator applied to the adaptive SDE has:
1872: 
1873: 1. **Weak error bound:** $\mathbb{E}[f(X_n)] - \mathbb{E}_{\pi_{\text{QSD}}}[f] = O(\Delta t^2)$ for smooth test functions $f$
1874: 2. **Stability:** The discrete-time Markov chain remains ergodic with invariant measure approximating $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$
1875: 3. **Foster-Lyapunov preservation:** The drift inequality $\mathcal{L}V \le -\lambda V + b$ for the continuous SDE translates to the discrete chain with error $O(\Delta t^3)$

items.label: cor-lyapunov-c3
items.title: $C^3$ Regularity of Total Lyapunov Function
items.content:
1899: :label: cor-lyapunov-c3
1900: 
1901: The total Lyapunov function $V_{\text{total}}(S) = V_{\text{pos}}(S) + \lambda_v V_{\text{vel}}(S)$ used in the Foster-Lyapunov analysis satisfies $V_{\text{total}} \in C^3$ with N-uniform bounds:
1902: $$
1903: \|\nabla^3 V_{\text{total}}\| \le K_{\text{total},3} < \infty
1904: $$
1905: 
1906: where $K_{\text{total},3}$ depends on the third-derivative bounds of the confining potential $U(x)$, the fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$, and the quadratic velocity term.

items.label: cor-smooth-perturbation
items.title: $C^3$ Perturbation Structure
items.content:
1951: :label: cor-smooth-perturbation
1952: 
1953: The adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x_i, S) = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)$ is a **$C^3$ perturbation** of the backbone system, with:
1954: $$
1955: \|\nabla \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\| = \epsilon_F \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le \epsilon_F H_{\max}(\rho)
1956: $$
1957: $$
1958: \|\nabla^2 \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\| = \epsilon_F \|\nabla^3 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le \epsilon_F K_{V,3}(\rho)
1959: $$

items.label: cor-regularity-hierarchy
items.title: Regularity Hierarchy Complete
items.content:
1987: :label: cor-regularity-hierarchy
1988: 
1989: The fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ satisfies the complete regularity hierarchy:
1990: $$
1991: V_{\text{fit}} \in C^1 \cap C^2 \cap C^3
1992: $$
1993: 
1994: with k-uniform and N-uniform bounds at each level:
1995: 
1996: | Regularity | Bound                                                      | Theorem                              |
1997: |------------|------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|
1998: | Cp         | $\|V_{\text{fit}}\| \le A$                                 | Axiom 3.2.1                          |
1999: | $C^3$      | $\|\nabla V_{\text{fit}}\| \le F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)$ | Theorem A.1                          |
2000: | $C^3$      | $\|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le H_{\max}(\rho)$           | Theorem A.2                          |
2001: | $C^3$      | $\|\nabla^3 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le K_{V,3}(\rho)$            | Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity` |
